headline.main: BLUM AND MANDEL LOSE FRENCH SEATS; Among 12 Ousted as Jews From Parliament by Vichy Decree

lead_paragraph: VICHY, France, Nov. 27 -- Because they are Jews and therefore excluded from elective assemblies by the law of June 2, 1941, three Senators and nine Deputies were declared by decree today to have forfeited their parliamentary man-dates. Prominent among them are Leon Blum, former Premier, and Georges Mandel, former Minister of the Interior, both of whom are "detained" at Portalet Fort in the Pyrenees.
abstract: Blum and Mandel among those who lose Parliament seats by decree barring Jews
